summary: Meet Old Goldpiles at the crossroad at Midnight. He has tricks and treats to sell, some new and some for convenience. This mod lets you stack your gold in piles and includes a few things on which to spend your massive fortune.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=2][center][/center][/size]
[size=5][color=#ffe599]EVEN IF YOU ARE [i]NOT[/i] AN UNGRATEFUL BASTARD, FEEL FREE TO DOWNLOAD AND [/color][color=#93c47d]ENDORK[/color][color=#ffe599] THIS MOD.  [/color]
[/size]

[size=3]ALL THAT GOLD, AND NOTHING TO BUY WITH IT?[/size][/b][size=3] I know someone who can help you with that, buddy.[/size]

[size=3]Go down by the crossroads at Midnight and Old Goldpiles will appear. Yes he's real. He's a little red but has a trustworthy smile. He'll make you a deal you can't refuse. Some of his tricks aren't even expensive...[/size][b]like how to instantly drop your gold into neat 100 piece piles.[/b]

[size=3]He knows where the Secret Imperial Vaults are, and how to get in. They say the Emperor's coffin-sized gold bars are in them. Or he can send you to visit the colossal Daughters of Dibella. The myth says they've been bathing for centuries. Wanna return to Skuldafn? He can get you there -- maybe even to Sovngarde.[/size]

[size=3]If you need a helper who would rather cause destruction than talk your ear off -- and if you can afford it -- he can sell you the conjuration for She Who Hates All. [/size]

[size=3]He knows how to conjure a Shellbacked Diving Hare. They're nearly extinct, but hardy and amphibious. They can stealthily distract predators for you, or just swim in your pool. He has odd little boxes that work like reusable soul gems. Lose a witch head? He's got 'em. Lose a dragon claw? He's got 'em. Don't rip off Lucan and Valeria -- I saw you looking! [/size]

[size=3]Old Goldpiles has all that and more. Take your money to the crossroads by Honningbrew Meadery at the edge of town. At Midnight he'll do business with you. Don't be scared. Just tell him your good buddy Sam Guevenne sent you.[/size]

[size=3]------------------------------------------[/size]
[size=3]Install with NMM. Requires Dragonborn.[/size]
[size=3]Click the link up there that reads "Posts" and then carefully read the comments at the top with a red border around them. Those are called Sticky Comments; they "stick" to the top so as to make sure you get the information that you need.[/size]
